conclusion: To find the maximum value of the electromotive force (emf) generated by the alternating current generator, we need to consider the given information and the principles of electromagnetic induction.
Number of turns of the coil (m): 100
Resistance of the external resistor (R): 90 Ω
Magnetic flux (Φ) varies sinusoidally with time as shown in Figure (Z).
From the graph in Figure (Z), the maximum magnetic flux through the coil is given as: Φ_max = 2 × 10^-2 Wb
The graph shows that the flux varies sinusoidally. The period (T) of the sinusoidal variation can be determined from the graph. The period is the time taken for one complete cycle of the sine wave.
The angular frequency (ω) is related to the period by: ω = 2π/T
Substituting the value of T: ω = 2π/6.28 × 10^-2 = 2 × 3.14/6.28 × 10^-2 = 100 rad/s
The maximum emf (E_max) generated in the coil is given by: E_max = m · Φ_max · ω
Substituting the known values: E_max = 100 × 2 × 10^-2 × 100 = 200 V
The maximum value of the electromotive force generated by the alternating current generator is 200 volts.
